TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Interesting, so please tell me what files / folders should I keep to have only the sun? Just the ones in the "sunflares" folder or something else? The dll maybe? Some cfg or shader?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Aniruddh said:
> 
> 
> Hi, I'm getting a terrain bug on Laythe in ksp 1.8.1 with latest scatterer for that version (playing on Windows 10):
> 
> 
> 
> 
> My aircraft crashes into the gap in the terrain frequently. My player.log below:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oLgxGZNb7XrKI-Utnemf8bqDLFf2dcHy/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oLgxGZNb7XrKI-Utnemf8bqDLFf2dcHy/view?usp=sharing)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks
> 

I don't know if this is the actual culprit, but you have the same error message as this: [https://github.com/LGhassen/Scatterer/issues/90](https://github.com/LGhassen/Scatterer/issues/90), the guy who reported the issue narrowed it down to a mod called " Real Expansion" causing the issue.

If that doesn't solve it:

-Update scatterer (you're on 1.8.1 but not on the latest version)

-Try to remove all other mods and test with scatterer alone

> 
> 
> 45 minutes ago, ThRodrigues said:
> 
> 
> Interesting, so please tell me what files / folders should I keep to have only the sun? Just the ones in the "sunflares" folder or something else? The dll maybe? Some cfg or shader?
> 

Don't delete any files. Go in "scatterer/config/planetsList.cfg" and delete very item inside "scattererCelestialBodies"

If you look in the player.log file, there should be a report on the installed mods (generally the ones with .dll files).  You can use this to start your list and reduce your burden.  If you use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, use the export function.

> 17 minutes ago, Not a Spy said:
> 
> 
> where is that file
> 

Read the post linked in my sig block for good problem-solving/trouble-shooting info you should be providing whenever you report an issue.  As for the location:  

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> - Windows:
>     - - 1.8 or newer:
>         - %USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\Player.log
>     - - 1.7.3 or older:
>         - KSP\_win\KSP\_Data\output\_log.txt (32bit) or
>         - KSP\_win64\KSP\_x64\_Data\output\_log.txt (64bit) or
>         - %USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\output\_log.txt
> - Mac OS X: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'Reports'. Scroll down the list and find the one which says "Log Reports", click that.  A list of files will be displayed in the top part of the window, in there will be Player.Log ( Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log ).  Right-click on it and select "Reveal in Finder".
> - Linux: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal\ Space\ Program/Player.log
>

>

I've already provided this info.  Read the post linked in my sig block for helpful info, including locations and names of the log file for your system (OS and KSP version dependent) or reread the reply I gave you up-thread by a few posts.  I might be misinterpreting what you're asking for, though.  What exactly are you not understanding?

The log is created every time you run KSP.  New one overwrites the old one.  Find it, copy it if you need to keep it, upload it to Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive or similar, get a link to it, and put the link in your post using the icon at the top of your message that looks like a chain link (just to the left of the quote icon).  Do <u>not</u> post the file contents here directly.
